name: Brandeis University Mock Trials Association
description: The Brandeis University Mock Trial Association (BUMTA) is the official, student-run mock trial organization of Brandeis University in Waltham, MA.

name: Robotics Club
description: A club for those interested in building robots.

name: Education for Students by Students
description: The mission of ESS is to provide the platform FOR students BY students to develop and share your unique ideas through presentation and conversation.

name: Active Minds
description: Through campus-wide events, Brandeis Active Minds aims to remove the stigma that surrounds mental health issues, and create a comfortable environment for an open conversation about mental health issues in our school community.

name: Behind the Scenes
description: The club members work together to provide theater tech and shop support to the shows happening on campus.

name: Boris' Kitchen Sketch Comedy
description: The club members perform student-written sketch comedy, and educate others about writing and performing.

name: Brandeis African Student Organization
description: BASO seeks to culturally empower African students and the student body at large to become socially, politically, and critically aware of African Cultures.

name: Brandeis Ballet Club
description: To further educate Brandeis students in the history and development of ballet, train students in the technical aspects of ballet, and raise awareness of dance as an art.

name: Brandeis Mixed Martial Arts
description: BMMA will instruct on basic and advanced approaches to martial arts, self defense, and combat sports.

name: Brandeis Pole Dance and Fitness
description: Brandeis Pole Dance & Fitness club aims to promote both mental and physical health and fitness through careful instruction of techniques in stretching, plyometrics, isometrics, and Aerial Pole Dance.

name: Brandeis Hillel
description: At Hillel, students forge new friendships, meet dedicated mentors, celebrate the Jewish calendar, engage in service to others, and find inspiration in Jewish texts and traditions.

name: Catholic Student Organization
description: The Catholic Student Organization will: 1) foster spiritual growth as individuals and as a community; 2) provide support, fellowship and recreation; and 3) keep the spirit of our Catholic community alive.

name: Brandeis Muslim Student Association
description: The Brandeis Muslim Student Association serves to provide an opportunity for members of the Brandeis community to explore and practice Islam.

name: Brandeis Basketball Club
description: The club provides everyone at Brandeis the opportunity to play basketball as a competitive level.

name: Brandeis Mountain Club
description: The club aims make the outdoors more accessible and enjoyable for all in the Brandeis community.

name: Brandeis Swim Club
description: The club aims to provide a supportive group environment for Brandeis students who want to swim in a team setting, by holding practices and other events for members to attend.

name: Brandeis Women's Volleyball Club
description: Brandeis Women's Club Volleyball's mission is to create a supportive environment for any member of the Brandeis community wishing to learn and play volleyball.

name: Disabled Students' Network
description: The club aims to provide a space for disabled students to cultivate disability pride and culture and to learn and practice advocacy while centering values originating from the Disability Justice Framework like intersectionality and cross-disability solidarity.

name: GirlUp Brandeis
description: GirlUp is an international organization under the United Nations that has chapters in Secondary and Higher Education around the world.

name: Brandeis Men of Color Alliance
description: Brick upon brick, we unite as foundation of extraordinary strength worthy of serving future Brandeis students.
